meanings.definition: A flaw or imperfection caused by the wind.
meanings.sent1: The old barn had a windflaw in its roof, letting rainwater seep through.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a small windflaw in the fabric of her favorite scarf.
meanings.sent3: The windflaw in the kite made it spiral uncontrollably in the sky.
meanings.sent4: His argument had a windflaw that weakened his entire case.
meanings.sent5: The painting was beautiful except for the windflaw in the corner that marred its perfection.

meanings.definition: To expose to the wind in order to dry or cool.
meanings.sent1: She would windflaw the laundry on the clothesline to dry it quickly.
meanings.sent2: The farmer decided to windflaw the harvested wheat in the open field.
meanings.sent3: He would windflaw his face to cool down after a long run.
meanings.sent4: The open windows allowed the breeze to windflaw the room, making it feel fresh.
meanings.sent5: The chef would windflaw the hot soup to cool it before serving.
